content.description: Let <math> <mi>f</mi> </math> be a polynomial function with degree greater than 2. If <math> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo>≠</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> </math>, which of the following must be true for at least one value of x between a and b?
content.question: I. <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math> II. f′(x) = 0 III. f″(x) = 0

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
